summary: This is a court notice from the Second Circuit Court of Appeals regarding case 21-58, United States v. Maxwell. It records the denial of Ghislaine Maxwell's renewed motion for bail or remand to the district court. The notice includes electronic mailing information for attorneys of record.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The appellant whose renewed motion for bail or remand to the district court was denied by the court.

persons.name: David Oscar Markus
persons.context: An attorney of record for the case who is listed to receive electronic notice of the court's order.

persons.name: Bobbi C. Stemheim
persons.context: An attorney of record for the case who is listed to receive electronic notice of the court's order.

connections.description: David Oscar Markus is listed as an attorney of record to receive notice for the appellant, Ghislaine Maxwell.
Bobbi C. Stemheim is listed as an attorney of record to receive notice for the appellant, Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Second Circuit Denies Maxwell's Bail Motion
events.description: The United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit issued an order denying Ghislaine Maxwell's renewed motion for bail or to remand the case to the district court.

keyFacts: The Second Circuit Court of Appeals denied Ghislaine Maxwell's renewed motion for bail or remand on June 2, 2021.
The case numbers referenced are 21-58 and 21-770, indicating it is an appellate proceeding.
Attorneys David Oscar Markus and Bobbi C. Stemheim are listed as attorneys of record to receive electronic notice of the court's decision.
The document is a formal court order (MOTION ORDER) filed electronically in the appellate docket.
